author: James P. Howley F.P.S.
notes: Possible loanword into Beothuk from JavaneseBeothuk is extinct language of Newfoundland Canada,  Algonquin-like but perhaps not Algic in origin. Perhaps a loan from the whaling period. See also Beothuk  - methabeet 'cattle'- nethabete 'cows and horses'Compare with Javanese    - sapi 'cow'Native speaker wroteow-as-bosh-no-un ?  Whale's tail'  (speaker included the ? suggesting perhapsow-as-bosh-un-no   orow-as-posh-no-un ?   (hard to tell if letter is a  b or p)Compare with  iwak paus buntot   'whale tail'  (Googletranslate)  in Javanese which (speaker option) sounds to me like [ iwa paus bundo ]
